items.title: Trump Administration Adds Anti-Trans Notices to Restored Websites
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- Federal judge ordered the Trump administration to restore certain federal websites.
- New disclaimers added, rejecting “gender ideology” and portraying it as inaccurate.
- Disclaimers are part of an executive order against transgender individuals, promoting a narrative that denies their existence.
- Websites restored include those previously taken down in compliance with this order, impacting LGBTQ references and histories.
- Ongoing initiatives target transgender rights, including blocking healthcare and altering documentation.

items.title: Mastodon will add quote posts, even though some users don’t want them
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Mastodon is introducing quote posts to transition users from proprietary social media platforms to the open web.
- Initially resisted due to concerns over misuse, it aims to implement features to prevent harassment and allow users control over their posts.
- No specific timeline for rollout; development may take time due to technical challenges with standardization and codebase impact.

items.title: The best indie games we’re playing right now
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Indie games offer unique experiences and can be just as engaging as big-budget titles.
- The Verge highlights lesser-known indie games worth playing, which will be updated frequently.
- Featured games include:
  - [Spirit Swap: Lofi Beats to Match-3 To](https://go.skimresources.com/?id=1025X1701640&xs=1&url=https%3A%2F%2Fstore.steampowered.com%2Fapp%2F1592170%2FSpirit_Swap_Lofi_Beats_to_Match3_To%2F): A match-3 game with relaxing lo-fi music that evokes nostalgia.
  - [Rift of the NecroDancer](https://www.theverge.com/games-review/605588/rift-of-the-necrodancer-review-music-game): Combines rhythm with strategy in a music-infused adventure.
  - [Citizen Sleeper 2: Starward Vector](https://www.theverge.com/games-review/601114/citizen-sleeper-2-starward-vector-review): A cyberpunk storytelling game utilizing RPG mechanics.
  - [Lok Digital](https://lok-digital.com/): A surreal puzzle game involving made-up words with unique powers.
  - [Antonblast](https://www.theverge.com/2025/1/18/24344598/antonblast-review): A retro-inspired platformer that channels the chaos of childhood cartoons.
  - [Skate City: New York](https://www.theverge.com/24339211/skate-city-new-york-review-apple-arcade): The sequel to the mobile skateboarding game set in an urban environment with a focus on music and flow state.

items.title: Climate group that called for ‘free Palestine’ stripped of federal funding
items.author: Justine Calma
items.summary:
- The EPA canceled over $50 million in funding for the Climate Justice Alliance (CJA) after backlash from conservative groups for advocating a ceasefire in Gaza.
- The CJA was to distribute subgrants for local environmental projects under the Inflation Reduction Act as one of 11 grantmakers named by the EPA.
- CJA plans to end its grantmaking program due to the cancellation, which would have benefitted communities facing pollution and environmental justice issues.

items.title: WhatsApp is getting themed chat bubbles
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- WhatsApp introduces new customization options for chats, including themed options and custom chat bubble colors.
- The feature will roll out globally over the coming weeks and includes 30 new wallpaper choices.
- Users can set themes for specific chats or apply them across all chats via Settings > Chats > Default chat theme.

items.title: Meta’s Ray-Bans have sold 2 million pairs — its maker is prepping to sell 10M each year
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Meta's Ray-Ban smart glasses have sold 2 million pairs since their October 2023 debut.
- EssilorLuxottica is aiming to increase production to 10 million pairs per year by the end of 2026.
- CEO Francesco Milleri emphasizes the glasses as a main digital platform and hints at future support for third-party brands and AI features.
- Meta plans to enhance their glasses with multimodal AI and subscription services.
- The glasses will be promoted with significant marketing efforts, including Super Bowl ads.

items.title: Senate Republicans introduce bills to make EVs more expensive
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Two bills introduced in the Senate aim to significantly increase electric vehicle prices.
- The Eliminating Lavish Incentives to Electric (ELITE) Vehicles Act would eliminate the $7,500 EV tax credit and other incentives, sponsored by Sen. John Barrasso.
- The Fair Sharing of Highways and Roads for Electric Vehicles (Fair SHARE) Act would impose a $1,000 tax on EV purchases, introduced by Sen. Deb Fischer.
- Both bills face potential opposition from some Republicans whose districts benefit from Biden’s EV investments.
- The $1,000 fee is designed to match gas taxes an average gasoline car owner would pay over ten years.

items.title: The EV Tax Credit: All the Cars, Rules, and Updates
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- The EV tax credit offers up to $7,500 off new electric vehicle purchases.
- Eligibility is based on various criteria including manufacturing location, battery sourcing, vehicle price, and buyer's income.
- The credit aims to promote energy security and reduce reliance on Chinese battery manufacturers.
- Automakers are moving to establish North American manufacturing to comply with the credit's requirements.
- The list of eligible vehicles changes frequently as the industry adapts to the new rules.
- Recent Senate bills aim to eliminate the credit and impose new fees on EV purchases.
- Hyundai, Kia, and Genesis vehicles have become eligible for the tax credit, reflecting ongoing industry adjustments.

items.title: Netflix says its brief Apple TV app integration was a mistake
items.author: Chris Welch
items.summary:
- Netflix briefly appeared as a participating service in the Apple TV app, supporting watchlist and continue watching features.
- This was confirmed to be an error by Netflix spokesperson MoMo Zhou, and the integration has been rolled back.
- Netflix continues to prefer users access its content exclusively through the Netflix app without participation in content aggregation efforts.

items.title: Treasury Inspector General to Investigate DOGE Payments Access
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Two government watchdogs will investigate the Department of Government Efficiency’s access to sensitive Treasury payments systems.
- An audit on the Bureau of Fiscal Service’s payment systems was opened on February 6th, focusing on whether adequate controls were in place.
- The investigation will assess if DOGE staffers accessed information without appropriate clearances and whether any conflicts of interest occurred, particularly concerning Elon Musk's businesses.
- The audit is expected to be completed in August, with interim updates provided for critical issues.
- Senator Elizabeth Warren raised concerns over the Treasury's prior response, which prompted the investigations.

items.title: The inexpensive Roomba Combo j5 is over 50 percent off for Verge readers
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Roomba Combo j5 is currently $239 ($290 off) available at Wellbots with promo code 210VERGE.
- The Combo i5 is also on sale for $189 ($160 off) with promo code VERGE160, valid until February 15th.
- Both models feature vSLAM mapping technology, room-specific cleaning, and dual rubber brushes for effective cleaning on various surfaces.
- The Combo j5 includes AI-powered obstacle avoidance and modular cleaning options but does not support virtual keep-out zones like higher-end models.

items.title: TikTok isn’t out of the woods yet
items.author: Alex Heath
items.summary:
- TikTok's CEO Shou Chew addressed employees during an all-hands meeting, discussing the app's future in the U.S.
- Apple and Google reinstated TikTok in their app stores after receiving assurances from Attorney General Pam Bondi.
- Chew noted progress in building trust, despite challenges from political environments and mentioned that TikTok's ad business has stabilized.
- Future layoffs were hinted at, as Chew described certain teams as “bloated” and “clunky.”

items.title: Meta is working on ‘humanoid’ robots too
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Meta plans to design hardware and software for humanoid robots, focusing initially on household chores.
- A new team in Meta's Reality Labs will lead this initiative, collaborating with other robotics companies like Unitree Robotics and Figure AI.
- CTO Andrew Bosworth stated that current technologies in Reality Labs complement robotics development, enhancing Meta's AI and augmented reality projects.
- Competitors like Tesla and Apple are also advancing in robotics, showcasing their own humanoid robots and exploring new smart home technologies.
- Marc Whitten, a former CEO in the robotics field, will lead Meta's new robotics team.

items.title: Roblox is still trying to convince lawmakers it’s not social media
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Roblox is working to convince lawmakers it shouldn’t be categorized as social media amid new legislation aimed at protecting kids online.
- The Kids Off Social Media Act (KOSMA), which aims to restrict social media use for those under 13, advanced in the Senate.
- Roblox claims to be distinct from social media platforms by promoting education and safety for its young users, with 42% of its 85 million daily users under 13.
- The company has introduced new policies to enhance safety for young users, including improved parental controls and restrictions on social interactions outside of games.
- Concerns from lawmakers and parents regarding kids' safety on platforms like Roblox are prompting legislative scrutiny and discussions around regulations.
- Roblox’s chief safety officer emphasized the platform’s commitment to protecting young users through various measures that differ from typical social media practices.

items.title: Instagram starts testing new button that might downrank comments
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- Instagram is testing a button that allows users to signal discontent with specific comments privately.
- The button is represented by a downward-facing arrow next to the like button on comments.
- Pressing the button does not reveal any user actions or dislikes publicly; no dislike count will be displayed.
- Instagram may integrate the feedback into comment ranking to lower disliked comments over time to enhance comment quality.

items.title: Amazon to Remove Download Feature for Kindle Books Starting February 2025
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Amazon will remove the 'Download & Transfer via USB' feature on February 26, 2025, affecting how Kindle users back up their books.
- This feature allows users to download purchased books to their computers for backup or conversion to other formats.
- Users without Wi-Fi may find this feature useful as it provides offline copies of their books, especially in light of Amazon's history of removing titles remotely.
- The feature supports the AZW3 format for older devices; modern Kindles use KFX format, which has strict DRM protection.
- After the change, users can still use apps to send documents to Kindles via USB but cannot directly download purchased books to a computer anymore.
- Amazon has not provided a specific reason for the removal of this feature.

items.title: Small businesses are already feeling Trump’s tariffs
items.author: Mia Sato
items.summary:
- President Trump's tariffs on China, Canada, and Mexico are intended to support American businesses but are increasing costs for small businesses.
- Small businesses like Walnut Studiolo, which makes handmade leather goods, are facing price increases for materials due to tariffs.
- Specific components like specialty screws and magnets have seen significant price hikes, impacting pricing strategies for small manufacturers.
- Many US-based businesses still depend on components sourced from abroad, complicating the effects of tariffs.
- Tariff policies are creating confusion and price pressures across diverse online selling platforms like Etsy and dropshipping.

items.title: Nosferatu is making its Peacock streaming debut next week
items.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore
items.summary:
- Nosferatu remake will be available to stream on Peacock starting February 21st.
- The film features actors Lily-Rose Depp, Nicholas Hoult, and Bill Skarsgård.
- Subscribers will have access to both the original theatrical cut and an extended cut.
- The film grossed $95.4 million in the US and $175.9 million globally last year.

items.title: US tariffs: how Trump’s tax is hitting Big Tech and beyond
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- President Trump imposed a 25% tariff on imports of steel and aluminum, affecting various industries, including automakers.
- The new tariffs targeted imports from Canada, Mexico, and China.
- Big Tech companies remain largely silent on the impact of these tariffs despite their significant implications for the industry.
- The de minimis exemption for goods valued under $800 was suspended, complicating shipments from China.
- Many shipping companies are expected to face delays and new charges as a result of these tariffs.
- Smaller firms like keyboard manufacturer Qwertykeys have halted shipments to the US due to high costs from the tariffs.

items.title: You can get a 55-inch Hisense U7 for under $500
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- The 55-inch Hisense U7 is available for approximately $498, discounted by $301.
- Larger models, such as the 75-inch and 85-inch, are priced around $948 and $1,307.99 respectively.
- Features include a 144Hz display, Google TV software, full-array local dimming, Dolby Atmos support, and a 1,500-nit max brightness with HDR10 Plus and Dolby Vision capabilities.

items.title: Yellowjackets continues to stretch itself thin in season 3
items.author: Alexis Ong
items.summary:
- Season 3 of *Yellowjackets* continues themes of nostalgia and personal growth but suffers from diminishing returns.
- The show's premise involves a teen girl softball team surviving in the wilderness post-plane crash; adult survivors reunite years later.
- Early episodes feature recycled themes with messy character arcs and relationship tensions among the adult survivors.
- Episode 4 highlights a kangaroo court led by the young cast, reflecting their struggles with leadership and maturity.
- Critics note season 3's potential but suggest the series may not need to extend to five seasons, despite strong performances from the cast.
- Season 3 premieres on Showtime on February 14th.

items.title: Xiaomi’s 15 Ultra looks a lot like a Leica in new leaks
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Xiaomi is set to launch the 15 Ultra smartphone with Leica-inspired design elements.
- Renders show a dual-tone color scheme and a large round camera protrusion resembling traditional Leica cameras.
- The phone features a rumored 200-megapixel periscope camera system confirmed by CEO Lei Jun.
- Other camera specifications include a 50MP primary shooter, 50MP ultrawide, and 50MP 3x optical zoom cameras, plus a 32MP front camera.
- Key specs include a Snapdragon 8 Elite processor, 5,410mAh battery, and a 6.73-inch LTPO AMOLED display with 3200x1440 resolution.

items.title: Kagi’s search engine adds a more private way to search
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Kagi introduces a new privacy feature called [Privacy Pass](https://blog.kagi.com/kagi-privacy-pass) for its search engine.
- Privacy Pass allows users to make searches without them being traceable to their identities.
- This feature uses an authentication protocol that generates tokens which cannot be linked back to the user.
- Kagi emphasizes the technical impossibility of tracking users while allowing them to search freely.
- Users can enable Privacy Pass in Kagi's Orion browser (available on macOS, iOS, and iPadOS), the Kagi app for Android, and in browser extensions for Firefox and Chrome.
- Kagi also supports access via Tor with a specific onion address but warns that without Privacy Pass, searches can still be linked to user accounts.
- Privacy Pass is available for $10/month Professional plan and $25/month Ultimate plan users, not included in free or $5/month Starter plans.

items.title: More Tesla showroom protests planned for this weekend
items.author: Andrew J. Hawkins
items.summary:
- Protests planned outside Tesla showrooms nationwide this weekend due to Elon Musk's behavior and political activities.
- Demonstrations advertised under the tags "Tesla Takeover" and "Tesla Takedown," with at least three dozen events listed on Action Network.
- Vandalism reported, including defaced Tesla vehicles and threatening notes found on cars, encouraging owners to sell their vehicles.
- Tesla's stock price has dropped 30% from its all-time high, impacting sales in key markets.

items.title: The Best iPad to Buy
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- All iPads are high-quality and versatile, making them the best tablets on the market.
- Apple offers six iPad models including Pro, Air, Mini, and the regular iPad, each with different specs and prices.
- Consider your budget before shopping; prices range from $350 to over $1,000.
- The most popular size for iPads is around 11 inches, while specific use cases might require smaller or larger models.
- Compatibility with accessories varies; check before purchasing.
- Identify your usage type: casual use or intensive tasks like video editing to choose the best model.
- The base model iPad is the best starting point, priced at $279, but be cautious of upcoming new releases in 2023.
- For the highest performance, the iPad Pro is recommended, starting at $999, offering exceptional power and features though at a high price.
- The iPad Mini is lightweight and ideal for handheld use, priced at $399 but lacks some accessory support.

items.title: Elon Musk: agent of chaos
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Elon Musk is significantly influencing various sectors, including overseeing parts of the federal government.
- Recently, Musk offered to buy a stake in OpenAI, intensifying internal chaos within the organization.
- The Vergecast discusses pressing topics, including the state of DOGE and implications of Musk's actions.
- OpenAI's CEO Sam Altman mentioned plans for GPT-4.5 and GPT-5, focusing on technology advancements and usability.
- The episode also covers gadget news, including new rumors about Apple's products and advertising innovations from Jeep.

items.title: Netflix finally decides to play nice and support the Apple TV app
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- Users of Apple TV 4K in the US can now link their Netflix accounts to the Apple TV app, allowing integration of certain Netflix originals into the app.
- Netflix is listed as a participating service in the Apple TV app, although the full catalog is not yet available and the rollout is ongoing for US users.
- This change marks a shift from Netflix's previous resistance to being part of third-party platforms, which had included avoiding platforms like Google TV.

items.title: The technology team at financial regulator CFPB has been gutted
items.author: Lauren Feiner
items.summary:
- Around 20 technologists at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) were fired, impacting oversight of Big Tech in financial products.
- This layoff follows previous cuts affecting mostly contractors and probationary employees, part of a trend under President Trump's administration.
- The firings occurred shortly after a set of technology team members were locked out of their work accounts, suggesting they were terminated without warning.
- Former CFPB officials express concern that consumer complaints may go unaddressed, harming oversight on financial practices.
- The CFPB's ability to investigate and regulate tech firms entering financial services is now compromised due to the loss of expertise.

items.title: Elden Ring Nightreign's Director Embraces Stressful Gameplay Experience
items.author: Ash Parrish
items.summary:
- Junya Ishizaki, the game director of Elden Ring Nightreign, aims to create stressful gameplay similar to the board game Pandemic.
- Players face a tense decision-making experience as they navigate dungeons with a looming storm, Night's Tide, threatening them.
- The game focuses on co-op gameplay, challenging players to work together rather than overpower enemies alone.
- Nightreign departs from the loneliness of previous FromSoftware titles, aiming to foster group cooperation and tension.
- Ishizaki acknowledges existing fans might be confused by the multiplayer focus but believes they will adapt once they experience the game.

items.title: Elon Musk’s DOGE website has been defaced because anyone can edit it
items.author: Jess Weatherbed
items.summary:
- The DOGE website, linked to Elon Musk, uses an insecure database accessible to anyone for edits.
- Experts revealed that unauthorized entries were made on the site shortly after the security flaw was reported.
- The site, launched in January 2025, had limited functionality initially but now sources posts from the DOGE X account and other regulatory stats.

items.title: Microsoft Outlook’s new minimize button makes mobile emails much easier
items.author: Tom Warren
items.summary:
- Microsoft is introducing a minimize button for Outlook mobile to enhance email drafting efficiency.
- The feature will allow users to minimize draft emails and switch tasks without navigating away from their drafts.
- The minimize button is in testing phases for iOS and Android and will be rolled out to all users soon.
- The feature aims to streamline email management, similar to task-switching methods used in Apple's Mail app and in Gmail.

items.title: Open source code repository says ‘far-right forces’ are behind massive spam attacks
items.author: Dominic Preston
items.summary:
- Codeberg blames far-right groups for a spam and harassment campaign targeting its platform.
- Users received abusive emails on February 12th due to a flaw in the notification system, which was exploited by an abuser.
- Codeberg reassures users that their private data was not leaked and is enhancing protections against similar attacks in the future.
- The organization emphasizes the threat posed by far-right ideologies to the open source software community.

items.title: Trump's First 100 Days: Impact on the Tech Industry
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Trump’s $10 million settlement with Elon Musk's X (Twitter) from January 6th lawsuit is significant.
- Trump aims to recover $20 billion in funding awarded by Biden’s EPA to curb emissions.
- Federal workers have shifted from platforms like Facebook to encrypted apps like Signal, showing increased distrust.
- NHTSA has censored car crash data reflecting non-binary identities, aligning with previous administration policies.
- The FCC is investigating Comcast's DEI practices under Brendan Carr's mandate.

items.title: The entire story of Twitter / X under Elon Musk
items.author: Verge Staff

items.title: TikTok ban: all the news on the app’s shutdown and return in the US
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- TikTok is back in the App Store after a temporary removal due to a US ban.
- President Trump signed an executive order delaying the enforcement of the TikTok ban for 75 days starting January 20.
- TikTok's service providers face potential penalties for operating the app in the US, despite it being available for download.
- The Supreme Court upheld the TikTok ban law.
- TikTok is now offering a download option for its Android app outside of Google Play due to removal from the platform last month.
- There are discussions around a potential deal involving Oracle and Microsoft to take over TikTok's operations while ByteDance retains a minority stake.

items.title: TikTok is back in the App Store
items.author: Jay Peters
items.summary:
- TikTok has been restored in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.
- The app was banned in the US for nearly a month prior to its return.
- US Attorney General Pam Bondi assured Apple that it wouldn't face fines for hosting the app.
- The removal followed a law banning apps from ByteDance, TikTok's parent company.
- Despite an executive order from President Trump not enforcing the ban for 75 days, Apple and Google initially refrained from hosting the app due to potential penalties.

items.title: Here are the best robot vacuum deals right now
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- Robot vacuums are becoming advanced, with models that vacuum and mop, plus self-cleaning features.
- Best deals include **iRobot’s Roomba Combo j7 Plus** for $599, and the **Dreame X40 Ultra** for $999.99.
- **Roomba j7** is currently $299.99, known for AI-powered navigation.
- **iRobot’s Roomba Combo j9 Plus** is priced at $799, featuring self-refilling capabilities.
- The **SwitchBot S10** is available for $612.99, offering a unique self-cleaning mop and bin system.

items.title: Elden Ring: all of the updates about FromSoftware’s open-world hit
items.author: Verge Staff
items.summary:
- Even Elden Ring’s game director admits that Erdtree difficulty is excessive.
- The DLC, Shadow of the Erdtree, expands the game significantly but carries similar challenges to the base game.
- New content will feature intriguing mysteries that might require a guide.
- Criticism arises regarding the character creator's inclusivity for Black players.
- Overall, Elden Ring is praised as a vast and compelling fantasy experience.

items.title: Gemini AI can now recall past conversations
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- Google’s Gemini AI can now recall past conversations for users with a Gemini Advanced subscription through Google One AI Premium.
- The new feature eliminates the need to recap previous chats, allowing Gemini to provide relevant responses based on past discussions.
- Users can also ask Gemini to summarize earlier conversations and manage their chat history at any time.
- The recall feature is available in English on the Gemini web and mobile app, with plans to expand to more languages and Google Workspace customers soon.
- Similar memory features have been implemented in ChatGPT as well.

items.title: Nvidia delays the RTX 5070 till after AMD’s reveal
items.author: Sean Hollister
items.summary:
- Nvidia delays the launch of RTX 5070 from February to March 5th, 2025.
- The RTX 5070 Ti will be released on February 20th, 2025, ahead of AMD’s Radeon RX 9070 announcement on February 28th, 2025.
- AMD is expected to utilize competitive pricing against Nvidia's offerings, as it has indicated it won't compete at the highest specification level.
- Rumors suggest AMD is developing a more powerful card with 32GB of RAM, although current announcements do not confirm this.

items.title: The best Presidents Day sales you can already shop
items.author: Quentyn Kennemer
items.summary:
- A roundup of the best deals for Presidents Day, including discounts on tech gadgets and home goods.
- Major retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/events/presidentsdaysale/?tag=theverge02-20) and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/rq53o3tpgl36i) are currently offering sales.
- Featured deals include Apple devices like the [AirPods Pro](https://www.amazon.com/Apple-Cancellation-Transparency-Personalized-High-Fidelity/dp/B0D1XD1ZV3?tag=theverge02-20) and [Apple Watch Series 10](https://www.amazon.com/Apple-Aluminium-Fitness-Tracker-AppleCare/dp/B0DGJBRKHV?tag=theverge02-20) at competitive prices.
- Additional discounts include Sony’s WH-1000XM5 headphones and Kindle Paperwhite devices.

items.title: Google’s latest Pixel phones are down to some of their best prices
items.author: Sheena Vasani
items.summary:
- Last-gen Pixel 8 starting at $399, discounted by $300 at retailers like [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Unlocked-Smartphone-Advanced/dp/B0CGTNPFZD/?tag=theverge02-20) and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/mqqfoyfunjvdh).
- Pixel 9 starts at $649 with $150 off available at [Google](https://store.google.com/product/pixel_9?hl=en-US), [Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Google-Pixel-Unlocked-Smartphone-Advanced/dp/B0D7HWJDQM/?th=1&tag=theverge02-20), and [Best Buy](https://howl.link/4fjnqw3q1qarc).
- Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL both have $200 off, priced at $799 and $899 respectively.
- Pixel 8 features include seven years of software support, wireless charging, and IP68 rating at a budget price of $399.
- Pixel 9 comes with a 6.3-inch OLED display, Tensor G4 processor, 12GB RAM, and improved dual-camera system.
- Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL offer advanced features like 16GB RAM, larger storage options, and fast 8K video recording.

items.title: How to get TikTok back on your phone if you deleted it after the ban
items.author: Barbara Krasnoff
items.summary:
- Apple and Google have restored TikTok to their app stores in the US, allowing downloads for both iOS and Android.
- The ban on TikTok remains, but enforcement is paused for 75 days per President Trump's order.
- Users without the app can download it directly from TikTok's website on Android, or access it via a web browser on iOS.
- iOS users must use alternative methods, like VPNs, to bypass regional restrictions and access TikTok.
- On Android, users can also choose between TikTok Lite and the full app depending on their device's capability.

items.title: Google Maps in the US will change to Gulf of America and Mount McKinley
items.author: Todd Haselton
items.summary:
- Google plans to update Google Maps to reflect President Trump's executive order changing Gulf of Mexico to Gulf of America and Denali to Mount McKinley.
- The changes will appear once the Geographic Names Information System is updated.
- Denali was previously known as Mount McKinley until 2015.
- The U.S. Department of the Interior will implement the name changes immediately for federal use.

items.title: Trump says he’ll put tariffs on imported chips ‘in the near future’
items.author: Richard Lawler
items.summary:
- Donald Trump announced plans to impose tariffs on foreign computer chips, semiconductors, and pharmaceuticals.
- He expressed skepticism regarding the effectiveness of the $52 billion in subsidies from the CHIPS Act under his potential administration.
- Trump suggested that instead of subsidies, manufacturers will be incentivized by avoiding taxes to bring production back to the US.
- Critics point out past tariffs increased consumer prices significantly on various electronics.
- During a speech at the House GOP Issues Conference, Trump predicted more manufacturing plants could be built in the US shortly, though specifics remain unclear.
- Trump indirectly referenced DeepSeek's AI advancements as a positive development in the tech sector.

items.title: FBI’s warrantless ‘backdoor’ searches ruled unconstitutional
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
• A federal court ruled that the FBI's searches of US citizens' communications under Section 702 of FISA are unconstitutional, violating the Fourth Amendment.
• The ruling was made by US District Court Judge LaShann DeArcy Hall, coming after years of litigation. 
• The case involved Agron Hasbajrami, whose emails were obtained without a warrant. 
• In 2023, the FBI conducted over 57,000 searches of US person data, a 52% decrease from 2022.
• The ruling declares warrantless searches unreasonable and calls for a legislative warrant requirement to protect citizens’ rights.

items.title: Sony reduces OLED burn-in fears with a three-year warranty on InZone monitors
items.author: Umar Shakir
items.summary:
- Sony extends the warranty on InZone M10S gaming monitors to three years, including coverage for OLED burn-in.
- The M10S was launched in September 2024 with an initial one-year warranty.
- This move aligns with a trend among manufacturers to offer burn-in coverage; Alienware and LG are notable examples.
- Consumers are advised to check warranty details for burn-in coverage on other models, as policies vary by manufacturer and model.

items.title: Now Apple tells us how to update AirPods
items.author: Andrew Liszewski
items.summary:
- Apple released a detailed guide on updating AirPods, AirPods Pro, and AirPods Max firmware.
- Updates now require users to wait for the process to occur automatically.
- New specific suggestions include charging with a USB cable and waiting 30 minutes for the update.
- Step-by-step instructions provided for connecting AirPods and checking firmware versions.
- If the firmware is outdated, users are advised to reset the AirPods and repeat the update process.

items.title: DeepSeek: all the news about the startup that’s shaking up AI stocks
items.author: Emma Roth
items.summary:
- DeepSeek is challenging AI industry giants like OpenAI and Meta with cost-efficient large-language models.
- Their flagship R1 reasoning model claims comparable performance to OpenAI’s o1 equivalent.
- The Janus Pro multimodal AI model reportedly outperforms leading models such as Stable Diffusion and DALL-E 3.
- DeepSeek’s AI assistant rapidly rose to the top of the App Store, causing Nvidia’s shares to dip by 17% by January 27, 2025.
- The startup launched in 2023, creating open-source models with less funding and hardware than its competitors.
- The app is currently limiting user sign-ups due to a surge in demand and “malicious attacks.”

items.title: The Pebble smartwatch is making a comeback
items.author: David Pierce
items.summary:
- Eric Migicovsky, founder of Pebble, seeks to revive the smartwatch.
- Google has agreed to open-source the Pebble OS, with the firmware now available on [GitHub](https://opensource.googleblog.com/2025/01/see-code-that-powered-pebble-smartwatches.html).
- A new company is being established to produce wearable devices that emulate the original Pebble experience, with a waitlist available at [RePebble](https://repebble.com/).
- The revival will focus on the unique characteristics of Pebble, such as simplicity, long battery life, and a quirky appeal.
- The new project is intended to foster an open-source community around Pebble OS, encouraging innovation in wearable technology.
